abstract.p: MARC USA and Change Technology Partners invest $20 million in cash and stock to start eHotHouse, e-services agency that will focus on strategy, application systems and marketing (S)

block.p: MARC USA in Pittsburgh and Change Technology Partners in Greenwich, Conn., have invested $20 million in cash and stock to start eHotHouse, an e-services agency that will focus on strategy, application systems and marketing.

EHotHouse will open with 15 employees working from offices in New York and seven other cities where MARC USA has offices: Chicago; Coral Gables, Fla.; Dallas; Indianapolis; Orlando, Fla.; Pittsburgh; and Troy, Mich. The new agency is serving as the e-commerce arm of MARC USA, handling work for clients like Bear Stearns and Rite Aid, and taking on accounts of its own.

Matthew Ryan, 39, chief executive and president at Ryan Drossman/ MARC USA in New York, becomes chief executive at eHotHouse and Change Technology; the other officers of Ryan Drossman/MARC USA will now run that agency.
